column_content.text: Our fixed spreads won’t suddenly change in reaction to the market. They start low and stay low, so you always know where you stand.
Access multiple markets around the globe from one single account to make sure you never miss a profitable trading opportunity.
Our powerful intuitive platform gives you the edge, helping you stay on top of your trading game. Or you can opt for MT4, whichever best suits the way you trade.

With just a fractional deposit, you can make a much bigger trade. That’s because we loan you the amount you need to maximise profit potential. Naturally, this can mean bigger losses too.

description.text: The latest Triennial Survey of FX Turnover published by the Bank for International Settlements (BIS) indicated that average daily volume in the United Arab Emirates had risen to $66 billion per day.

Middle East presents for the wider FX industry and companies like Trade Nation, who focuses on technology. Middle East  is a region with sophisticated and tech-savvy traders and investors. We have internally maintained technology platform as well as awards-winning MT4 that is not only operationally robust, and the structure we have allows us to add new instruments quickly, being responsive to our clients' requirements.

description.text: Our commitment to providing all traders with a fair deal is more than just a promise. We’re reliably regulated by some of the world’s most respected financial governing bodies. We abide by the highest standards and strict laws that govern the markets you trade in. Whether your clients are seasoned traders or new starters, you can count on us for all the support you need.

content.text: Ready to refer clients and start earning?

section_content.text:
With Trade Nation you get three very important advantages: value, certainty and support. 

Our fixed spreads are amongst the narrowest and most competitively priced around. Narrow spreads generally cost less to trade versus variable spreads. Fixed spreads let you know your trading costs up front. Together, they give you greater control. With regular trades, you’ll notch up serious savings over spreads that can widen at the whim of the markets. Throw in our 24/5 dedicated, professional and friendly Customer Success Team and you’re ready to go.  

But that’s not all:  
* Negative Balance Protection: if your account goes into arrears, we’ll automatically reset it to zero
* Markets you want to trade: we focus on the markets where  traders like you are most active 
* Transparency, fairness and honesty:  no commission, free withdrawals, no hidden costs
* Traders first: you’re the reason we’re here, so your needs always come first

section_title.text: Who is Trade Nation regulated by?

section_content.text: Trade Nation is regulated in the UK by the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA); in Australia, we’re governed by the Australian Securities and Investments Commission (ASIC); and in the Bahamas, by the Securities Commission of The Bahamas (SCB).

section_title.text: My Account - Which web browsers can I use with the trading platform?

section_content.text: For the best experience, you can’t beat Google’s Chrome browser. But if that’s not an option, Firefox, Safari and Microsoft Edge all work well.

section_title.text: How long before I can start trading?

section_content.text:
You should be up and running within one business day, so long as we have all the necessary details from you. If we need anything else, our Customer Onboarding team will let you know what and why. 

Ready to trade? Let’s go. Fill in our short sign-up form now and we’ll get back to you as fast as we can.

section_title.text: Which types of payment can I use?

section_content.text: We accept debit cards, credit cards, bank transfers and Skrill. For customers living in the UK, we also take deposits using PayPal.

Trade Nation is a trading name of Trade Nation Australia Pty Ltd, a financial services company authorised and regulated by the Australian Securities and Investments Commission, ACN 158 065 635, AFSL No. 4226

The information on this site is not directed at residents of the United States or any particular country outside the UK, Australia, South Africa or The Bahamas and is not intended for distribution to, or use by, any person in any country or jurisdiction where such distribution or use would be contrary to local law or regulation. 

Full Legal notices

content.text: We are always looking to join forces with people who are committed to creating the best possible experience for our traders.
If you’re the owner of a website, social channel, mobile app or provide trading education, webinars, coaching or have an ad network that can forward traffic to us – we want to hear from you!

And as an affiliate, your customers will have access to some of the best price spreads around, on the most popular markets available. With market insights, analysis and amazing customer support as part of the package, we provide a trading experience that’s second to none.
And, with our generous reward model*, you have the potential to build a lucrative business by simply introducing customers to us.
*Terms and conditions apply
Ready to refer clients and start earning?

description.text:
This one is not using one of the 10 pre-made dropdown options, but you can put any percentage on the opacity.  I use 50 so we can compare this with the pre-made ones. This one, I've set the font colour to black, looks like the opacity is also applied to the font and make them illegible when we go for a lower opacity %.   Suggest to remove this option, Fox. 
For this one, the triangle has an overlap effect that we are unsure if you would like it, hence we then proposed the 10 pre-made shades.   18px font size for desc and bullet points.

content.text: Trade Nation began life back in 2014, when we were known as Core Spreads. Building on our award-winning reputation for market leading low-cost spreads, we soon grew. And grew. From a single office back in the day, we’re now dotted around the globe - the UK, Australia, Bahamas and Malaysia to be exact!

columncontent.text: We see many of our competitors promise the world but fail to deliver. In contrast, we treat our clients and colleagues with respect. For traders, this means transparent fees with no hidden costs or nasty surprises. For the people who work at Trade Nation, it’s the opportunity to grow with a fast-paced fintech firm that values ideas, creativity and enthusiasm.   Of course, you don’t just have to take our word for it.

Here’s what some of the industry’s experts have to say:

description.text:
Our commitment to providing all our traders with a fair deal is more than just a promise. We’re reliably regulated by some of the world’s most respected financial governing bodies. You can always count on us to abide by the highest standards and strict laws that govern the markets you trade in.

Whether you’re a seasoned trader or a new starter, you can count on us for all the support you need to help you trade in a way that works best for you.  


Regulated by:
UK - Financial Conduct Authority 
Australia - Australian Securities and Investments Commissions  
Bahamas - Securities Commission of the Bahamas

media.name: Brand - About us - london skyline - PJC 1500px.jpg

description.text: We have a busy presence across all the big social media platforms - come find us @itstradenation.  And, while we love cute animal posts, our channels will provide you with information on reactive market news and trading commentary rather than pictures of friendly, fluffy things.

content_field.text: As an affiliate, your customers will be able to access some of the best priced spreads around, on the most popular markets available. With market insights, analysis, and amazing customer support as part of the package, we provide a trading experience that’s second to none. And with our generous rewards model*, you have the potential to build a lucrative business by simply introducing customers to us. Like to know more? *Terms and conditions apply
Our sponsorship
We’re proud of the partners we work with. They’re a reflection of our ambition, values and spirit.

Wolverhampton Wanderers 
We’re thrilled to be the official FX trading partner of Premier League club, Wolverhampton Wanderers. This relationship also extends to being the official partner of Wolves Women too.
We’re committed to supporting the club beyond just their on-field performance, as we are also heavily involved with their foundation to support fundraising efforts throughout the season.
As part of the Wolves family, we share their values of determination and progressive thinking when it comes to providing the best possible trading experience for our clients.

Somerset County Cricket
We’re proud to be a principal sponsor Somerset Cricket Club, a long established team with an equally strong history of achievements. In addition to supporting the first eleven and other elite-level teams, we sponsor the Somerset Cricket Foundation for boys and girls, helping to ensure that future generations of Somerset players have every opportunity to succeed.

contents.text: We’re always keen to help out where we can and are proud to have done so for a number of deserving causes. We were delighted to contribute well over £20,000 in sponsorship and charity donations in 2022 alone.

We know that a team is only as good as the people who make it up. Everyone brings something different to the party – and everyone is respected for their individual skills and who they are. But we all have one thing in common: a shared passion and commitment to making things better. 

We welcome the curious, the creative, the visionaries, the makers and doers. Everyone has a place here – as long as you want to make a difference. 

That’s what’s fuelled our growth. But we’re not where we want to be yet. We have big plans and a clear purpose. And you could be the person that helps us reach that next stage of development. 

So if you’d like to work at the cutting edge of fintech with a smashing bunch of people who you can inspire and learn from, get in touch today – and take your first step towards a great career at Trade Nation.

caption.text: Scalping (local document sprint9) is a day trading  (weblink to the About us page) method that entails (anchored link https://v2.fin.tradenation.com/sprint9/#usps) entering and exiting trades quickly. Scalping differs from other forms of day trading tactics in terms of holding durations and the type of market research carried out.

Most day trading techniques allow traders to hold positions for several hours within the same day using both fundamental and technical analysis. Most scalpers exclusively utilise technical analysis tools.

col2_contents.text: Address:  Trade Nation Financial UK Ltd, Floor 6, 14 Bonhill Street,

content_field.text: Key takeaways
Scalping is a trading strategy that focuses on benefitting from tiny price movements and generating a quick profit.
Scalping requires a trader to have a precise entry and exit plan since one major loss might wipe out numerous small winnings.
Scalping requires the necessary equipment, such as a live feed, a direct-access broker, and the endurance to concentrate closely on how markets are behaving.
Understanding scalping

The goal of scalping is to make small, low-risk profits by taking advantage of slight price swings in the market. Scalpers typically open numerous positions believing that many small gains will ultimately add up to a significant profit at the end of each trading session.

The argument for scalping is that minor price changes occur far more frequently in the market than large price movements. A scalp trade is usually closed when the asset price makes a small move above or below the breakeven. Once opened, scalpers are happy to close the trade with a small profit after covering the spread.

When scalping,  both manual and automatic trading techniques can be employed. Manual scalping requires experience and a cool head. This is due to the strategy's requirement for speed, attention, patience, and in-depth trading expertise to hunt for profitable trading opportunities in short periods.

As a result, most scalping activity is generally carried out utilising trading bots (expert advisors), designed to trade the market automatically using programmed algorithms. Scalping greatly benefits from automated trading since it ensures speed and efficiency in order entry and exit. The scalper bots also assure uniformity in strategy application. They also help to eliminate the emotion inherent in human trading.
What you need to know before scalping

Scalping demands a trader to be extremely disciplined, but it is also extremely time-consuming. While longer trading timeframes and smaller trade sizes allow speculators to move away from their platforms, scalping requires a trader's unbroken concentration.
Potential entries might come and go quickly. Thus a scalper must stay connected to their trading platform. Scalping is not the best trading style for people with day jobs.

Scalping is a challenging method to put into action. One of the key reasons is that successful scalping generally requires trading repeatedly during a trading session. Scalping necessitates rapid reactions to market fluctuations and the capacity to close a trade quickly if it doesn’t work out as planned.

Scalpers are frequently unsuccessful due to 'chasing' trades and a lack of discipline. The thought of merely being in the market for a short time is appealing, but the probability of getting stopped out on a price that swiftly reverses is significant.
While some scalpers are regularly successful, they are in the minority. Most traders benefit from a longer-term perspective, smaller position sizes, and a slower tempo of activity.
Pros and cons of scalping trading
Pros
Scalping exposes you to less risk in the markets.

As scalping does not rely on large price changes in the market, it has the potential for a trader to book a high number of profitable trades. Because scalping only targets small gains every trade, your win % will likely be higher than other strategies.
Scalping allows you to take advantage of as many trading opportunities as possible.
When scalping, you don't need a thorough fundamental understanding of the asset you're trading because trades are based only on basic technical analysis setups.
There are no rollover or swap fees; only spreads are charged.
Cons
Scalping is a naturally difficult method requiring significant focus and patience to perform the same task repeatedly.
Because scalping entails many trades, the spread fees can quickly build up.
Scalping is time-consuming and requires traders to log a certain number of screen hours daily.
Scalping is often done with bigger lot sizes. This implies that a string of losses might significantly hurt trading capital.
The essential elements of the best forex scalping strategies
Any Forex scalping technique focuses on specific market moves and depends on having the correct tools and discipline to capitalise on them.
Here are some of our top scalping trading essentials to keep in mind.
Risk management

Because the gains from scalping are often small, practically all scalping methods employ higher-than-normal leverage. While leverage can increase gains, it can also increase losses. As a result, risk management is critical.

High leverage is especially dangerous during news releases when markets get volatile. The spreads tend to widen in such situations, unless trading with a provider offering fixed spreads. To avoid this, always utilise an adequate leverage ratio while scalping and traders should never trade more than they can afford to lose.
Trading outside of your comfort zone often has negative financial consequences.
Self-control

Scalping strategies need a certain amount of mental strength. Traders must be able to manage their emotions, remain calm, and maintain their composure in order to profit from scalping. Emotional responses might lead to poor trading decisions resulting in losses.
Market conditions
Market conditions are very important as they can impact profitability when scalping. As a result, scalping is often carried out under challenging market circumstances.
Setting goals

Traders should first identify their realistic goals in order to find the finest strategies. Of course, the goal of traders entering the market is to profit. When trading using scalping, keep in mind that profits will be limited.

Whatever trading style a trader picks, they must ensure that it suits them and that they are comfortable with it. Any effective scalping trading system must have a well-planned, disciplined, and adaptable strategy.
Scalping trading strategies
Stochastic Oscillator

A stochastic oscillator can be used as part of a  scalping strategy. The word stochastic refers to the present price's position in relation to its recent price range. Stochastic indicators help to highlight possible turning points by comparing the current price of a security to its recent range.

Scalping using such an oscillator seeks to capture moves in a ranging market, i.e., one that moves up or down consistently. Before a turning point occurs, prices tend to close at the extremes of the previous range.

The five-minute chart below shows a chart of EURUSD where the stochastic lows give entry possibilities for long trades when the green line crosses over the dotted red line. When the stochastic hits the upper end of its range, over 80, or when the bearish crossing emerges, when the red dotted line crosses below the green line, this signals that the long position should be closed.

On the other hand, short positions would be employed in a downward market, as seen below. Instead of 'buying the dips,' we're selling the rallies.' As a result, we will watch for bearish crosses in the trend's direction.
Scalp with moving average
Another way is to use moving averages to identify the trend, generally with two very short-term ones and a considerably longer one.

On a five-minute EUR/USD chart, we use 20 SMA and 50 SMA (simple moving averages) for the short term and 100 SMA for the long term. As you can see in the below chart, we get a sharp rally once 20 SMA and 50 SMA crossover 100 SMA.

In the chart below, all the moving averages have turned lower, with the shortest leading the move. Therefore, we look for opportunities to sell when both the 20 SMA and 50 SMA cross below the 100 SMA. That provides us with a potentially bearish set-up.
It is critical to note that these trades follow the trend and that we are attempting to capture only some of the move.
Relative strength Index (RSI)

Traders may utilise the RSI to identify entry positions corresponding to the current trend. Dips in the trend should be bought. Therefore, a suitable buy position can be opened when the RSI falls below 30 and then rises back above this line. In contrast, an opportunity to sell is formed when the RSI reaches 70 and begins to fall back.

content.text: Put simply, our unique proprietary platform is Made to Trade.  Easy to access and intuitive to use, it puts you in pole position when it comes to trading the markets you love most. All the while keeping risks and costs firmly under control. Throw in unrivalled customer support and expert market insights, and you’re all set for success.

column1body.text: Our fixed spreads mean you’ll always know how much your trading costs will be – whatever the market does.

column2body.text: We won’t ask for a set deposit before you’re able to make a trade.

column3body.text: Unlike some platforms, we don't charge when you make a withdrawal.

description.text: Seasoned traders also have the option to use the popular platform MetaTrader 4. Better known as MT4, the platform lets you trade CFDs across a wide range of markets, from Forex and indices to equities and commodities.

items.title: Others hide costs. We reduce them.

content.text: We offer some of the tightest spreads around.  Commission free.  Fixed and transparent.
Our Customer Success Team helps you run things smoothly. We’re available 24 hours, Sun to Fri, 10pm-10pm (GMT) by chat, email or phone.
Stay on top with real-time news, market analysis and twice daily reports. Sharpen your trading skills and find your next move.

column_content.text: Our fixed spreads won’t suddenly change in reaction to the market. They start low and stay low, so you always know where you stand.
Access multiple markets around the globe from one single account to make sure you never miss a profitable trading opportunity.
Our powerful intuitive platform gives you the edge, helping you stay on top of your trading game. Or you can opt for MT4, whichever best suits the way you trade.
With just a fractional deposit, you can make a much bigger trade. That’s because we loan you the amount you need to maximise profit potential. Naturally, this can mean bigger losses too.

contents.text: To keep trading costs as low as possible, we offer some of the narrowest fixed spreads around. Unlike variable spreads elsewhere, they won’t change at a moment’s notice in response to a market move.  You’ll always know up-front what your trading costs will be. So you can avoid nasty surprises.           Find out more

There are a number of good reasons experienced traders choose us for CFDs. First, by short selling CFDs against other securities, you can protect against falling prices. Second, CFD trading is fully leveraged, so you only need a small amount of the total trade to get started. Third, with us, you can access well over a thousand markets from a single account

As further protection, should your account fall into arrears, we will automatically bring the balance up to zero*. This prevents you from losing more money than is actually in your account at any given time, whether you’re trading fixed spreads or CFDs.  
*Sorry, we can’t do this for professional traders.

bullet_point.text: No minimum deposit
Free withdrawals and deposits
Negative balance protection*

description.text: Trade your preferred markets on our fast and intuitive proprietary platform or MT4

primary.disclaimer: *If your account slips into arrears, we’ll automatically correct it to zero - only for non-professional traders.

columncontent.text: In a volatile market, trading costs can escalate scarily quickly. It’s not helped when some platforms ramp-up costs during busy trading times. Not on our watch. With fixed spreads that start low and stay low, regular traders can really rack up worthwhile savings.    Check if i can do spaces.             Find out more

Controlling trading costs is key to maximising profits. Few things take the shine off a successful trade more than hidden costs eating into your funds. That’s why, when you trade with us, you can forget about commission, deposit fees and withdrawal charges.

content.text: With us, you get some of the best-priced fixed spreads across the markets you most want to trade. With zero commission and no hidden fees to worry about, you’re free to trade your favourite markets and keep a lid on costs. A range of powerful trading tools - from independent insights to your own real-time news feed - delivers a real competitive edge. And with our friendly, knowledgeable 24 hours, Monday to Friday Customer Success team in your corner, you’re all set to trade.

column1body.text: Our fixed spreads mean you’ll always know how much your trading costs will be – whatever the market does.

column2body.text: We won’t ask for a set deposit before you’re able to make a trade.

column3body.text: Unlike some platforms, we don’t charge when you make a withdrawal
